page.title: 12 Garden Centre Harlestone H.
page.content:
This centre, utilising good sandy soil and road communications, was opened in 1970. It covers an area of seven acres. An average of 1,500 people from all over the county visit each week, mostly at weekends. The main items sold are trees and shrubs (brought in once a year) and rock and bedding plants and vegetables. The house plants come from Holland and Denmark.
There are buildings housing greenhouses, sheds and conservatories, made by a firm in Irchester. The prices for these range from 700 pounds- 7000 pounds.
The whole area is very pleasantly landscaped.
